title: Can you make car decals with a Cricut? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, but you’d be much better off with ANY other machine. A Cricut is a machine for home crafters. If you’re making car decals to sell, you should buy a cutter from a sign supply company. There are quite a few, but the most important thing is, make sure the cutter you get will accept Roland-compatible blades. Roland is pretty much the gold standard of contour cutters (and they’re priced to match!) and there’s a huge selection of Roland-compatible blades on the market. Sign supply companies will have the other things you will need, like blades, squeegees, Oracal marking film (accept no substitutes!), weeding tools and transfer tape.
